review.reviewBody: Primus has delivered a workhorse of a stove system that is well designed for a wide range of uses, primarily backpacking.  I really love how modular the PrimeTech kit is that I can pair it down and remove pieces to lighten it up for somewhat fast and light trips or I can keep it in its original form for extended trips in the backcountry.  The built-in heat exchanger on the ceramic non-stick PrimeTech pan was a very nice touch to increase speed and efficiency with the limited gas you can carry.  The only thing I wish Primus would change would be to include an adapter to accept white gas for cold weather conditions.
review.name: High Quality Stove Set
comment: You can use the stove in cold conditions by inverting the fuel canister, it is designed to work that way.

review.reviewBody: Bought size 39 for girlfriend who normally wears size 7.5 US Woman. According to charts it should fit but length was a little short.  Bigger problem was the width. These were way too narrow for her

review.reviewBody: This was my first clipless (option) shoe and I had to do a ton of research to figure out exactly what I needed to do (ie instal the SPD cleats that came with my new pedals). I decided to include the spacer given the other reviewer here and absolutely no trouble on my first clipless ride. I did a 35 miler and found these to be comfortable right out of the box, easy to clip and unclip. I?m not used to hard soles so my toes went slightly tingly at times if I forgot to move them while on a long flat road but did not last. Overall: comfortable, sturdy, easy to clip in and out of, and well made!  I am a 6.5 so sized up and got the equivalent of a 7 and they fit perfectly.
review.name: First clipless shoe

review.reviewBody: Debated buying these for several months. I'm a Kuhl pants "aficionado" and have several of their different styles, but these didn't live up to my expectations. The fabric is stiff and more canvas-like than chinos. The front styling through the pockets and crotch is very boxy and gave me a bit of a Sponge Bob thing going on. I was hoping to use these as a dressy-casual pant but they did not seem as dressy as my old Banana Republic or even Lululemon ABC pants. All the comments on how easily they stain made me hesitant to use them for outdoor activities, or even sitting on a dirty picnic table. Overall, it wasn't worth keeping them as they didn't quite fit the bill.
review.name: Not as comfortable as advertised

review.reviewBody: I like Kuhl clothing, but they seem to have a workmanship issue that they need to resolve. Why are the back pockets different distances from the center seam when you spend over $100 on a pair of pants? Not just a little, but twice the distance. I have to order 2-3 pairs to get the pants that have even-spaced back pockets. I would keep these but they are going back due to workmanship issues. Otherwise, they would be great and I could recommend them to others
review.name: Kuhl Quality and workmaship not there

review.reviewBody: I returned the product due to sizing issues. I used the mailing label they gave me. They claim that they never got the product back, and no refund was given. They don't have any way to talk to a person on a live call. I wasted a lot of time on chats, and they kept saying they'll get back to me. They never followed up.
review.name: Bad experience with Backcountry

review.reviewBody:
As the one who does the laundry, these frustrate the h*** out of me. They're my partner's pants -- he loves how they fit, and they look great and have held up really well over the last two years. 

Problem being: YES, they STAIN and stain EASILY. The pictures posted in the other reviews are exactly what his look like.  

I finally lost all patience with his pants (deciding I don't care if I ruin the pants) and left Oxy stain remover spray on the stains overnight, after massaging it into the stretchy weave of the fabric (you've got to use that product, got to let it sit overnight, and got to massage it in to the fabric). The instructions say not to do this on khaki fabric, but I did it anyway. Regardless: if I soak the stains, massage the Oxy in, and let it sit for 24 hours...the stains are gone, the pants look just fine and weren't damaged by the stain remover. It's extra work and a bit of a pain, but it's the only thing I can do to get the stains out (rather than wash these things four times in a row). Also, this isn't a commercial for Oxy spray...we're starting to run through the bottle already. This is for the dark khaki pants...I dunno how this would work for other colors.

And, since I finally know the product that works and the procedure to get the stains out...we're unfortunately back to buy more of these pants. They're the only pair that 1) still looks really good (he wears them as work pants) and 2) have held up like a beast while his other pants have started to look ratty and full of holes. 

And...as the one who does the laundry...now that I've finally figured out how to get the stains out, I'm the one logging in to get him these pants. Cleaning is a bit of a pain, but it's doable, and they're unfortunately really nice-looking, comfortable, and durable pants. I'm not super enthusiastic, but at least I know how to get the stains out.

So...you've been warned.
review.name: like/hate relationship

review.reviewBody: These pants stain easy. Yes, they look great, as far as looks go and are super comfy, love the tapered legs (like regular resistor) however if you nudge your bicycle in the garage- it stains. If you bend down on the ground in your yard or garage- watch out! Yep, it stains. If you brush up against your car taking out the trash on trash day don't get any grime on your pants because you guessed it! It's stained. FOR LIFE. I tried everything. Finally hit the hard-stuff including stain remover and toxic T*** detergent and finally tried just using hot setting- nothing gets out the stains. I finally called customer service sent in pictures proof of purchase and was told "sorry- considered normal wear and tear." Please someone help me understand if a product is marketed as "trail to office" and you can't get out a common house-hold stain, what good is an over-priced pair of hiking pants like that? Just say no, thanks. I am, having been a dye-hard (snicker) fan of Kuhl, It's time to move on.
review.name: Resistor Chino stains easy Kuhl not Cool

review.reviewBody: I've owned these pants for two weeks, and I can't wear them anywhere but hiking/climbing anymore. I'm a careful person, but I got unlucky once or twice spilling a bit of food and drink on my pants. I've tried every possible way to remove the stains, but they are still obvious and ugly. It really is a shame because the pants fit and feel great, and I was probably going to order more. If you want to use wear these pants in a variety of settings, I would not recommend buying them.
review.name: The fabric stains too easily

name: Resistor Chino Pant - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Northwave Extreme Pro 3 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of Northwave shoes, and found after switching back from DMT and Diadora, I'll likely stick with Northwave (I liked the Diadoras too but they seem to be be out tof the cycling shoe business or at least you can;t find them here the US).  DMT were tight in the toes and only seemed to shrink.
While this model seems to be low on inventory, I hope Backcountry will continue to stock future models.
On to the shoes:
Easy on and off with the BOA.  Comfortable and well fitting.  There's a mesh that helps keep them airy. but that doesn't seem to greatly affect usage under booties for the winter.  One thing you first notice is if you wear bright socks, you'll faintly see those colors through the mesh.
To me these are good looking shoes, and they aren't the same Sidi, Shimano, and Specialized everyone seems to have.  They clean up nicely and easily too.
Pic after 16 months of use (uncleaned)
review.name: So much to like

review.reviewBody: These shoes check all the boxes; light, stiff, good-looking, comfortable, inexpensive. I like a little arch support and this shoe has it molded in the carbon, so no need for an insert. I have been wearing Sidi forever, and these are much less expensive, very good looking, and a bit more aero looking.
review.name: Comfortable High Performance

name: Extreme Pro 3 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.name: Over priced

review.reviewBody: This jacket served me well for 10 years of steady use every winter/fall and I finally replaced it. The quality is superb, the new Pertex Shield on the shoulders/arms gives it a much more durable feel. It has a premium feel in the hand and is a nice blend of weight/durability. Fits great with layers underneath, but also works well as a mid-layer under a shell. I'm a fan of the new color options too. In summary, this is a durable, lightweight, packable and versatile jacket that does its job in the back-country but transitions seamlessly to the front-country. Highly recommended.
review.name: Awesome Jacket!

review.reviewBody: Great warmth to weight ratio. Form fitting is just right!
review.name: Great tool in the toolbox

review.reviewBody: Light, warm, soft and comfortable jacket.  Fit consistent with size guide.  The blue is beautiful. I have an earlier generation of the same jacket that I have worn for over a decade.
review.name: My favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: Love the color! Quality is excellent as always. My new go-to jacket.
review.name: Stylish yet practical jacket.

review.reviewBody: I love the ghost whisperer jacket. The color of this one is called solar pink. In reality it is fluorescent orange. Not my favorite color.
review.name: Misleading color

review.reviewBody: I love how lightweight and packable this jacket is, its perfect to stuff into my backpack for long hikes, camping or even in my carry on when flying. Its warm enough for Montana winter and wind proof - not sure if its technically wind proof but it seems like it to me. The fit is more fitted than boxy and slightly tight in the arms/armpit area. Im  happy with the medium to give a bit more room. I have a small as well (from many years ago) and its just a little snug if I want to wear anything other than a tshirt underneath. Totally worth the clearance or sale price!
review.name: Love this ultra lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: Yuck color&predecessor had v-shaped batting on rear
review.name: If it ain't broke don't fix it!

review.reviewBody: I finally replaced my older MH jacket and this one is very nice!   I like the color and how warm and light it is.  Only complaints are it seems like the zippers on the jacket are of less quality than my former jacket and the pockets are placed abnormally high on the jacket as well.  Still love it but not a fan of design changes.
review.name: MH Ghost Whisperer

review.reviewBody:
A great choice for a packable puffy. Very warm for how light and packable it is. Perfect for layering or throwing into the bottom of your pack without taking up much space. 

I got a large, Im 510 155lbs and wish it was longer and less boxy. But it will be fine for a packable puffy layer.
review.name: Packable and warm

review.reviewBody: Shell fabric is very delicate and had an existing rip on arrival. This would not stand an accidental brush against a branch on the trail.
review.name: Warm, but delicate

review.reviewBody: Incredibly warm and light. Medium fits well (I have a small frame but large shoulders). I do wish the sleeves had a little more stretch in the wrist as they're a bit loose and I imagine that will be a little drafty. Love the color and very lightweight. Worth the price IMO. The medium weighs 193 grams.
review.name: Very warm for weight, high quality.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Carhartt Gloves Insulated Sherpa Glove - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are the warmest gloves I've ever owned. And they are a steal  for the price. 
They've kept my hands warm in sub-zero temperatures and shield your hands completely from any wind. The best!
review.name: Amazing gloves

review.reviewBody: I have Raynauld's Phenomenon.  I need to keep my fingers & mostly my fingertips warm.  They are warm gloves, I'm praying they work on keeping my fingertips warm.
These really keep my hands warm while outside in very cold temperatures!
review.name: THAT WARM FEELING

review.reviewBody: Best gloves I've ever owned. Definitely keeps my fingers warm. A little thick to use for everyday use but if you have raynauds you won't regret the purchase

I bought these in 2020 and LOVED them. I lost them and decided to purchase them again. The quality is terrible.  The sherpa is shedding already and I haven't even worn them yet. I'm so sad and disappointed.  Next time I'll purchase gloves from elsewhere.
Warm and comfortable. Hard to hold things, but that is expected. Overall, very pleased!
These gloves are Very Warm and super soft. They are a little bulky, so dexterity is a slight issue, but if you just need warm hands I would highly recommend these.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great for the cold weather and quite comfortable. My only dislike is that they are a bit bulky so using them while holding something can be difficult.
review.name: Soft, Warm, but Bulky

review.reviewBody: These gloves were a gift.  They will be used mostly on the fishing boat when the hands get really cold.  "The gloves are warm but they take some breaking in on the fingers.  Once this happens they will be perfect. " This is what my friend said about the gloves.
review.name: Warm Gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves are fantastic. Every year I pay way more on gloves where I lose one or they dont last more than one season. These are incredibly warm, to the point where I can take it off for a short time, and replace them with minimal loss of warmth. As someone whose hands are always frigid, these are the best gloves I have ever had, and the price is more than reasonable. The only drawback is they are a little bulky, but no more so than my other warm gloves.
review.name: The best

name: Insulated Sherpa Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the second Seral 7 I bought, this time for my friend because she has been complimenting mine so much. I love that I can take it biking or hiking. It is roomy enough for snacks and a light layer. The only negative is that the water hose does not stay in place and detaches easily from the magnet.
review.name: This is the second Seral

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Incredibly comfortable bag that my super sexy amazing boyfriend got me! Plenty of room for snacks and gear and it doesnt ride up or shift during rides.
review.name: Incredibly comfortable bag that my

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pack. It rides perfectly loaded with the essentials and water.
review.name: Great pack. It rides perfectly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Larger than expected, but perfect in many regards. Very comfortable when in use and a well thought out design.
review.name: Larger than expected, but perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag lots of pockets, i dont like water bags but can put a extra water bottle in bag as well.
review.name: Great bag lots of pockets,

review.reviewBody:
Similar to another review, the magnet is too weak to hold the hose over bumps. On my first ride with this pack I rode thru a rock garden and the hose detached and got caught in my rear wheel, shredding the bite valve and losing the hose magnet and dumping out all my water. After a month of contacting Osprey they said that I would have to contact HydraPak for warranty service on those parts as it's not made by Osprey...bought the parts locally but so much for an "Almighty Guarantee".

I bought an additional hose magnet at my own expense and used some fabric glue to attach the base about an inch away from the one on the pack to have 2 magnetic attachments instead of one. Smart right? That should do it? Wrong...riding with friends on a rough trail again the hose detaches, into the rear wheel and pulls off the bite valve and lose all my water again.

Pretty soured on this pack maybe I'll look at adding a carabiner like the other reviewer did. At this point if I use it again I will keep the hose end in the pack until I'm at a stop then unzip it to drink some. I don't trust the hose attachment after 2 epic fails and my poor response from Osprey.
review.name: Hose magnet attachement is an epic fail

review.reviewBody:
Great quality Osprey bag that fits well and holds a ton of stuff.
The problem is the hydration hose that wraps around your waist and the small weak magnets that secure the hose to the bag/ hip. These magnets are not designed for mountain biking as any medium sized bump results in the hose coming detached from the magnet and hanging precariously down your leg. I've had to use a caribiner clip on the hose and the hip pocket to keep the hose in place. Thankfully the hose has never wrapped up in my chain or tire and dragged me off the bike. I have inquired with Osprey about a stronger magnet system for the hose and bag and am waiting for a reply.
Till then, I ride without the hydration pack and use one water bottle on my frame and another bottle stashed inside the bad.
review.name: Great bag- poor hydration planning

review.reviewBody: Never thought I'd buy a fanny (hip) pack, but I did. The construction is of Osprey quality and has the usual design (e.g. key clip, net pocket, inner zippered pocket). It does need to be cinched down pretty well to keep from sliding off. After I started riding, I forgot it was on and it was nice to slide it around to get things out. Plenty of room for snacks in the belt zip pockets. The magnet is a bit weak that holds the bite tube and I wish it had 2L for longer summer rides or a way to hold a water bottle. The bladder does take up a lot of storage space, I do realize I'm asking for more water storage yet complaining how much room it takes up.
review.name: Good hip pack, expected Osprey quality

review.reviewBody: So frustrating just trying to fill this thing since you can't detach the hose, which you can do with camelbak. Also no water bottle holders which the camelbak also has.. the hose is super freaking long too, I had to cut mine down. It still just doesn't fasten properly and caused lower back pain when fully loaded. I honestly purchased this because I saw so many other people with them when hip packs were starting to get big. Don't be like me though go with camelbak or EVOL they fixed the mistakes on this pack, I wouldn't get this one unless you want to be disappointed.
review.name: Super Disappointed. Go with Camelbak.

review.reviewBody: I loaded this full with water and about 2 lbs of food and tools for a 6 hr gravel & road ride. Immediately, I noticed it would not stay put unless I cinched the belt (and compression) so tightly, it was uncomfortable...and then when standing, it would still slip on my lycra bibs. Hose is very difficult to reconnect to the magnet...needs a spring loaded lanyard/retractor to guide it back, and it popped loose in rough terrain and was dangling against my rear wheel. I gave up and stowed the hose planning to use it to simply refill my bottles, and the hose took a permanent kink and appears to have a crack developing.
review.name: Uncomfortable and hose is insecure and hard to use

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Shoutout ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been a loyal costa customer, but after after a change in ownership and warranty, also my sunglasses flew off my head so I needed a new pair, I decided to go in a different direction. I really liked the style of the Smith sunglasses, they looked fresh and s change of pace seemed good. After one use they have a scratch on the lense, I have no idea how fragile I presume. I owned my Costas for 4 years and never developed a scratch on my glass sunglasses. I'm baffled and frustrated, maybe it's chance, time will tell, but I've owned designer glasses for 14 years now and scratching has never been an issue for me. Displeased with the quality at this moment in time.
review.name: Quality sub-par

name: Shoutout ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: This not a pic of the 46t Shim this is another smaller size. The 46t in the shim has a massive jump from last to largest to largest cog. Go with the wonderfully machined and properly graduated microSHIFT Advent X CS-G113 Cassette 11-46t. Now, I believe there is another newer version of the Shim 46t that is graduated properly but what Backcountry/Competitive Cyclist is the old one. Again, looks nothing like this pic.
review.name: Not as pictured at all beware
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention, We are so very sorry we have the incorrect image, we will get that corrected. If you need any assistance with bike gear please reach out to our bike team!

review.reviewBody: I bought the 11-46. Went from 3X10 to 1X11 and got a bit more climbing gear out of the bike. Using a 30T RaceFace in front now. Pairing the two is a great combo for me. I can go as fast as I need with the 30-11 and having the 30-46 helps on the hills. (Although the front does get a bit light on the steep stuff.)
review.name: Great for 1X11 conversion

review.reviewBody: Honestly, Im not overly impressed by them. I understand that its a kids goggle, but it just doesnt feel like that superior of quality. I also specifically ordered these because theyre allegedly a goggle that goes over glasses (my six year old wears glasses), and I cant figure out how these are designed any differently than a normal goggle. Feeling dissatisfied about the purchase.
review.name: Goggle review

review.reviewBody:
I think the page for this item needs to state that these are child's goggles in the title. I bought these thinking they were simply OTG (over the glasses) goggles for adults and now my glasses won't fit into them. I went back to the page and realized the part about them being for kids was in the paragraph below the pictures. 

I bought these to keep my eyes from tearing up in the winter on my bike commute to/from work and they're great for that, but I can't see a lot of things close to me because I can't wear my glasses.
review.name: Daredevil Goggles are for Kids

review.reviewBody: Decided to buy Smith instead of a generic brand off another large retailer. Goggles are very basic construction.  Packed in a cardboard box without any film or protection on the lens so they have micro scratches from the start.   There was no goggle bag included, although the description says there should be.  Not a corner I want to see cut on kids goggles.
review.name: Adequate

review.reviewBody: The lens constantly pop out of the frame. Very poor design
review.name: The lens constantly pop out

review.reviewBody:
So far, so great! These goggles fit nicely over my 11 yo childs glasses. He says theyre comfortable. Look great. 
Shipped fast during the holiday as well!
review.name: OTG goggles

review.reviewBody: Im a very petite, older (77) woman that skis a lot. I always have trouble finding goggles that fit my Smith helmet. Kids size is perfect and lenses are also perfect.
review.name: Im a very petite, older

review.name: Solid Kids Goggle

description: Buy the POC Resistance Ultra T-Shirt - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Resistance Ultra T-Shirt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Resistance Ultra T-Shirt - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
GCN recently had a video asking what to wear with gravel. Honestly, I think this is it. It's not race tight thin jersey and it's not a cotton shirt that will get soaked. It's a medium to heavy weight shirt with pockets and a material that will do well with heat and sweat. It even has a stomach bib thingy majingy (the technical term) that when putting on you have to put your arms and head through it and the stomach strap goes around your torso keeping your jersey more secured to you and not fly around in the wind. It's a really neat thing but will take a second to figure out how to put it on (at least for me as I've never seen something like that).

Needless to say, I really like it. They look casual and like a nice semi fitted black shirt. I have a few good jerseys but I don't always want to wear them when it's a more casual ride or I'm going on gravel/trails and so this shirt is perfect for that.

I would like more color options as I would happily get another one.
review.name: Casual, High Quality, Awesome

review.reviewBody:
This shirt is dope. Is fitted but not skin tight. The pockets are ample. This shirt is UPF50+ but you?ll never wanna wear in the sun because the only color available is black (why aren?t there more colors???? :/ )
The waterproof zip pocket is only waterproof on the outside. I learned this the hard way. Your sweat will soak the interior of the zip pocket so don?t put things that need to stay dry in there.
review.name: Awesome non skin tight T

name: Resistance Ultra T-Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Tent Guy Lines online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tent Guy Lines
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Tent Guy Lines online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Worked just fine in a big wind with the mini groundhog stakes on a Habitude 4 tent. 

Just one fault. These things come in four packs. A Habitude needs seven to fully tie down the rainfly. Why can't they be packaged for particular tents?
review.name: Worked just fine in a

review.reviewBody: Got these to cover all the attachment points of my Habitude 4. Seems like they'll do the trick! But the knot that is tied in them by default is slightly too small for the hole it's supposed to stop. Under tendon it will pull through - I had to retie all of them with a bigger knot. Would recommend doing this before you are setting your tent up on the dark ..
review.name: Seems good

review.reviewBody: Lighter, stronger, reflective at night. A nice upgrade to certain stock guy lines. Many tents feature additional or optional guy line points but dont supply the guy lines. These function perfectly when additional stability is needed.
review.name: Nice Upgrade & Additional Stability

review.reviewBody: These guy lines work way better than the cheap ones that come with most tents, the quality of the reflective line and the cinch hoop are top of the line and you see the reflective line at night.
review.name: Definitely worth purchasing

review.reviewBody: I am very happy with my MSR Guy Lines. I especially like the circular tensioners as they are easy to adjust and they stay put. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent Guy Lines and Tensioners

review.reviewBody: MSR should develop a cordage storage sack if not patented by Exped since they are putting so much effort into cam rings, tent stakes, and reflective markers. All very good additions but with all the guy lines you have a tangling problem unless you are very careful in how it is packed up. In a wilderness situation it is frequently not possible to neatly put up the cordage without an aid like the cordage sacks.
review.name: storage needed

name: Tent Guy Lines

review.reviewBody:
Please note that while this says "Universal," it does not work on every bike. Rather, it works on any bike that uses the Universal Derailleur Hanger (UDH) as part of the frame design, which is becoming increasingly more common on bikes.

With that in mind, if your bike has a UDH, this is exactly the correct product to buy and it will serve you well.
review.name: ***PLEASE READ***

review.reviewBody: ...For bike manufactures that utilize the SRAM UDH. More and more companies are using this which is great because you no longer need a bike specific hanger. You no longer have to wait for the bike company to have their specific hanger back in stock. Now this UDH can be found everywhere.
review.name: It is universal

review.reviewBody: It states universal on the description hence I made the purchase but did not fit my mountain bike derailleur.   still have to pay for the return shipping cost even with incorrect description.
review.name: it states universal but did not fit

review.reviewBody: In the product details on this site it says, "Works with all commercially available MTB and E-MTB drivetrains." However, it does not fit in the 2022 Rocky Mountain Growler frame.
review.name: Not Universal

review.reviewBody: Does exactly what it needs to do. Super easy to install and requires little to no adjustment after getting the derailleur in there!
review.name: Great

I bought this at the end of last season and it is definitely one of my faves.  It is one of my heaviest base layers and I love it so much, I wear it as a sweater sometimes.  
Not sure if they changed it from last year....I bought the one that looks like a very dark pine green with dark pink highlights.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Beautiful sweater and great fit. But the first wash caused multiple (>6) holes. Probably faulty wool thread.
review.name: Wool is poor quality

review.reviewBody: This developed a hole in the elbow in just a couple months. I wore my Smartwool midweight baselayer 3x per week for three years before that happened. Do not recommend
review.name: Cute, comfy but poor quality

review.reviewBody: I think I'd have kept it if there was a little more room under the arms/across teh rib cage
review.name: small for me

review.reviewBody: I love the brand and have used them for years... Hoping this was a bad batch. The glue was almost non-existent to begin with, after the 3rd tour it became fully glue-less. Never seen anything like it. Also, the "hair" side damaged very easily.
review.name: I love Karakoram, but these are trash...

review.reviewBody: Same problem as other review, glue is not good. After I re glued they are great-good glide and decent on the uphill; but take extra ski straps for when it fails out of the box..
review.name: Good skins bad glue

review.reviewBody: Not sticky and almost useless when below 25 degrees. First time out using them in fresh powder, I was constantly having to take them off and scrap the snow out. At the end of the day, they were too cold and wouldn?t stick at all. I would not recommend these at all. The climbing and glide of these are great but not sticky enough.
review.name: No sticky

review.reviewBody: Excited to put these through the wringer. They look to be well built, use the same materials as my old skins, which had awesome glide and plenty of grip. They are pretty light compared to my nylon skins
review.name: Already Stoked!

name: Karakoram Smart Skins

hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Tungsten Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a replacement for my decade-old rei half dome, and this is perfect. It's actually very similar to the half dome. Very well made and durable. It's light enough for a few nights of backpacking, but is also big enough to be comfortable and great for car camping. It's not ultra light, but most of the time I don't need that and im happy to trade it for the extra durability. Easy to setup with color-coding. Highly recommend for an all-around tent. Extra roomy for 1 and comfortable for 2. My only wish is that they would add a few more mesh pockets in the interior for phone, keys, etc. there's only 2-3 pockets
review.name: Perfect all around Tent

review.reviewBody: The tent's pole snapped on its 41st night of use, with a second crack developing. There are a lot of great things about this tent, but that is simply far too soon for a significant break. My use is backcountry backpacking and canoe camping, but I take very good care of my gear and my poles in particular: always on a pack exterior, never under pressure within a pack. On the one hand, I think the shape, size, features, weight, and value of this tent are great. Until now, I've loved it. But if you have to be worried about whether your poles are going to have multiple breaks in the middle of a trip before you've even used it 50 nights, that undoes all the strong points. I'm not sure if this issue is a matter of low quality materials or if the geometry of the tent design exerts too much pressure on the poles.
review.name: Great Design but Poles Break
comment:
Hello there.

We sincerely apologize for the issue you had with the tent poles. For this particular issue, please kindly file for a warranty claim on our website and we will be more than happy to assist you further.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Were available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
As I write, it is 2024. I have had the tent since 2016. I use it as a 1-person tent.

I average about 45 days a year in this tent. It is not uncommon for me to pitch it, and leave it set-up, for 14 days at a time...this long UV-exposure use is hard on tents.

I have had zero problems with the tent. Never got wet, never blown away, no repairs, zippers are still 100%.

It is, of course, pretty darn snug if used by two people...but, that's the nature of 2-person backpacking tents, regardless of make/model.
review.name: The 2016 verson has been great

review.reviewBody: For entry level this tent is rather decent. However it has a few design flaws and cheapened materials (ie the plastic clips for one feel like they will break). The fly vent, when used in tropical locales where constant mist to drizzle is the norm, add a bit of wind and that vent on one side of the fly at the ceiling lets water in and I had puddles. If I closed it, the tent would condensate. The fly entry can also be annoying to go in and out, just a strange cut that I think needs a re-design. In other climates that I've used it in with heavier rain, the vent didn't seem to be an issue so if you have rain and wind turn the tent where the vent faces downwind.  One very bizarre experience is that it was a bit of a wasp magnet. They came in under the fly or through the ceiling vent (darn vent once again) and would get trapped between tent and fly, buzzing all night. Next day I'd remove the fly to free them and by evening they were back again. Never experienced this with any of my other tents. Is it the golden color they're attracted to? Who knows. Just a bad wasp year in Canada's North, perhaps.
review.name: Decent tent

review.reviewBody: I have owned several Marmot Tungsten tents over the years. I am a big fan of them. Unfortunately this version has a small section of zipper on the fly that serves no practical purpose. It does however allow water to run down and drip on the inner tent. I own two of these tents and I have determined it is definitely a design flaw due to that zipper. In moderate rain you will get water dripping on to the body of the tent and pooling on the floor. Very disappointing.
review.name: Great Tent with one significant problem
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our Tungsten 2-Person Tent product. We truly appreciate you bringing the design matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

Additionally, in order to get repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:
 
https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Were available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: My 2p Marmot Tungsten has been very reliable. It kept me dry through a few very heavy downpours in the Midwest. With doors on both sides, access remains easy whether I am by myself or have a tent mate. Perfect for myself and my hiking gear. Rainfly can be used multiple ways for either privacy, easy access or wind-flow. For the price, it is durable and reliable.
review.name: Reliable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent is fantastic for a to the point 2 person tent. I bought this tent after camping a handful of times with my friend who has an older model and was impressed by the ease of use/setup and packaging. One star was taken away for the choice of parts coloring, two pole ends and tent rivet tabs are dark blue while the rest are yellow. This is like having socks that have left/right printed on them, it's unnecessary and makes it look goofy if you mix it up. It would have been more favorable to make all tent pole ends the consistent yellow to make it easier to setup at night and reduce the chance of poking your friends eye out.
review.name: Lots of color mixing?

review.reviewBody:
This spring I took the greatest leap of adolescence and bought my first tent independent of my family. I knew I needed something that toed the fine line between durability and portability, as I would primarily be using it for river trips and backpacking. 

After an extensive and frankly obsessive research process, only the Tungsten 2p met my many demands. After some agonizing, I decided to take the leap, despite never owning a Marmot tent before. I am so glad I did!

My first night in this tent, my dog and I stayed warm and dry despite the inch of snow that fell on top of us. This tent vents in a way that frankly I didn't know was possible and feels relatively spacious for being just a 2 person. I would say it can comfortably fit two average sized people and two medium sized packs. 

I have used it now for an entire spring and summer season in the peaks of the San Juans and various river canyons of the Southwest. Never once have I awoken to a drop of condensation nor had it rattle in obnoxious winds. Its quick and easy to set up solo and can pack down incredibly small. The wide open mesh top allows for spectacular star viewing and perhaps best if all, it's a spectacular color! I couldn't recommend this tent enough if you need something light and durable or just want to make a wise investment in an introductory tent. 100/10
review.name: Perfect Balance Between Weight and Durability

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I REALLY wanted to love this tent! However, I was not too impressed with the quality. The rain fly seams were not flush with the tent poles.  We tried using the guy lines to pull out the wrinkles but it still bunched up in certain areas... I could tell this would be a problem in wet weather. Also, you have to awkwardly crawl under the rain fly to attach to the tent poles. 

Overall disappointed
review.name: Sadly disappointed
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and were so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Were available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent (tungsten 2p) is bulletproof. Its been through the ADKs , the Whites in NH, the Great Smokies, and everywhere in between. I split the weight up with my wife, and at around 2lbs each, (.9kg) you wont find a more durable, reliable piece of equipment worth that weight in your pack. Flash snow storms in may, high wind storms at elevation, and torrential downpours in the ADKs. Ive never had a drop of water in it once, and the hardware has held up better than anything Ive ever owned. Great gear as always!!
review.name: Marmot really delivers with this tent!!

name: Tungsten Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a narrow shoe but hoped that the water shoe design would allow a B width to fit. Alas, it did not.
review.name: Shoes were too big for me.

review.reviewBody: The width of the shoe was so wide I could have put both feet in with room left over. One size definitely doesn't fit all.
review.name: no

review.reviewBody: These shoes are made so well and fit perfectly in all the right places and are so functional and the color is amazing
review.name: I never get tired of Teva!!

review.reviewBody: Ordered my usual size, but they were much too long. I also found them difficult to put on. I assume that this would improve over time & breaking in.
review.name: Too big - had to return

review.reviewBody: They are comfortable and well made.. love the product.. Have bought Teva in the past and I came back because the product is well made and is durable for hiking and every day wear .
review.name: Love them!!

review.reviewBody: I have bought this same shoe at least 10 times. I teach water aerobics & love the support they provide. My favorite feature is the way they close together with combo velcro & buckle snap. Bungee shoes often come loose & I hate that. However, I don't understand why the glue that holds the sole to the upper shoe doesn't last. The soles constantly come unglued during exercise & I have to remove them because of the drag. I have glued them back on with every imaginable glue & nothing lasts. This happens after about 6-9 months of buying the shoe. But, I buy them again because of the other features. I'm just spending a lot of money continually replacing them
review.name: Love the shoe but hate the way the soles come unglued!

review.reviewBody: Well made, comfy wide front part but something about heel design impossible (for me) to slide into. Have another ancient pair Teva water sandals ..when comparing heel design this new design has smaller opening. The velcro strap seems useless and the back part curves in. Also, how many straps and snap closures does a shoe need?
review.name: I wanted these to fit but...

review.reviewBody: This shoe is sturdy and comfortable and fits true to size. I like the style of the shoe and that it's water resistant. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because I'm not too crazy about all the velcro closures which are not the most convenient to get in and out of. Other than that, I'm very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Sturdy and Comfortable Shoe

review.reviewBody: I actually use these for pickleball. They are the one shoe I've found that don't hurt my feet after hours on the court, however this last pair I bought are a little bigger than my previous 2 pairs and not as comfortable without thicker socks. I almost sent them back, but they're okay with the thicker socks and feet still don't hurt so I kept them, but I'll be looking for another shoe to replace them.
review.name: I have bought this product 3 times.

review.reviewBody: These didn't work for me. They felt stiff, heavy, uncomfortable, and hard to put on and take off. The Teva Tirra works much better for my needs.
review.name: I found these very stiff, uncomfortable, and hard to put on

name: Omnium Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I loved the color and quality of these shoes. However, the fit was poor. Based on previous reviews, I ordered 1/2 size bigger than my usual size. Lengthwise, it was good. But it was just too narrow. Just too tight on the upper part of the foot. These shoes would be ok only for people with very narrow feet. Unfortunately they are going back.
review.name: Beautiful shoe, poor fit

review.reviewBody: I don't know what is going on with Danner but I wish they would return to the old fit. These have a narrow toe box (I sized up for this reason) and the heel is so wide that even with thick socks my heel slipped out.
review.name: looks good

review.reviewBody:
I'm always a true size 8 in sneakers and hiking boots (keen, new balance, and danner) I have slightly narrow feet and found these to fit pretty small. I thought would work in summer with thinner socks which helps but wish I had returned and exchanged for size up before trying to break them in.
Other than sizing I think they are great quality and a all around solid trail shoe.
review.name: Good hiking shoe but runs small

review.reviewBody: I have regular width feet, fit is narrow, purchased a half size up, fit is tight. There are rough edges where the tongue if the shoe meets the inside that feel like needles poking the top of your foot. I had these on w>th wool hiking socks in the house and could not bear the pain for 15 minutes, need to return. Very disappointed. Going back to Salomon, the best fit ever, no pain.
review.name: Danner hiking shoes
comment:
Hi Christine! Thanks for your review!

Sorry to hear these didn't work out, hopefully a Gearhead was able to assist you with a free return or exchange :)

review.reviewBody: I've completed 3 very different hikes with these shoes, and they were fantastic each time! I originally my usual size (6.5), but ended up sending back for a 7. I was grateful for the extra toe room yesterday when navigating a pretty rocky downhill. The grip held up on mossy rocks and downed trees for two different river crossings. The shoes were comfortable with no break in period, and definitely kept me going all day strong. I had been looking for several months for the right hiking shoe, and these are 100% them. You will not regret this purchase!
review.name: Best Hiking Shoe I've had!

name: Trail 2650 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the MSR Windburner Stove Group System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Windburner Stove Group System
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Windburner Stove Group System online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Excellent system! Performed perfectly for all our trips this summer for a party of 12. We used both the 5L and 2.5L pot for all of us and it was perfect. Uses very little fuel and cooks fast. 
Only drawback I see is that you can ONLY use the pots designed for the system. Also it would be a good upgrade to have the pots lock in place. 
Be aware the little clip that hooks the lid on has a tendency to fall off. When you get the pot use some pliers and tighten all of them - definate design flaw. It would be simple to just make these so they don't come off.
review.name: Excellent for groups!

review.reviewBody: The pressure regulator is genius. We cooked an entire breakfast on an "empty" cartridge. The lid is likely to fail soon. One out of four stoves already has a ripped rubber knob because the locking handle is poorly designed. The stove worked well on a recent trip, but the numerous reports about the thermal switch are concerning.
review.name: Lid will not last long

review.reviewBody: First day of use and stopped Ive been using the smaller wind burner for years but the first time I used the group stove it failed. Ive been following the links and see the information for resetting the thermal trip.. but it doesnt show how to do this on the tripod windburned with remote canister. Embarrassing as well as I was leading a group of people youngsters. Sat in the cold with no working stove.
review.name: MSR group stove stopped working

review.reviewBody: Used for maybe, 8 days use, has stopped working. Sadly stopped working in a very remote area of Scottish Highlands causing the trip to sto several days early. Have used MSR stoves for 3 decades both professionlay as a guide and in my own time I was surprised to be let down by this.
review.name: Stopped working after light use!

review.reviewBody: I bought this a couple of years ago and used it half a dozen times. It abruptly stopped working during use and the warranty department takes 9 to 16 weeks depending on where you read it to get your item back to you
review.name: Don't buy

review.reviewBody: This stove system is amazing! I used it in Mt Baker, Washington and had windy conditions during our trip. The stove just worked amazing and was very easy to setup/use. Would definitely recommnend it
review.name: Great stove system!

review.reviewBody: Just used for a week straight. Wind performance as expected is amazing. Pot size is perfect for 2 very, very hungry people or 2 and a kid. The pot coating is impressive. It sautees veggies wonderfully. I'd cook those, transfer to a bowl, then finish cooking in the main pot. Did not miss having the skillet really. One 8oz canister lasted 5 days, could go way longer if just doing freeze dried.
review.name: Delivers

review.reviewBody: I recently took the MSR Windburner Combo system on a week-long bike tour along the central coast of California. After hours of research I decided that the Windburner Combo fit the criteria I was looking for, large enough to cook for multiple riders and easy to use in the winds along the coastline. This stove not only met but it exceeded my expectations, as MSR usually does. At first I thought that the pot was a little big for what I wanted, but once I started to pack I found I could fit the stove, my bowl, a spork, lighter, coffee, and my reusable food wraps in the pot this saved space and kept the kitchen gear organized. This stove has great temperature control, I was able to boil quickly as well as keep food at a low simmer all without having to worry about the stove blowing out. Thanks to the radiant heater being fully enclosed we were able to easily cook on the beach or on the windy hillsides overlooking the ocean. The rings on the bottom of both the pot and skillet are meant to hold heat on the bottom of the cookware, but I also found that your pot or pan will always be centered on the burner which keeps even heat over the pans and adds lots of stability this is great for people who like to do more cooking while on their adventures! The ceramic coating makes the cleanup a breeze which is great after a long day of riding. The pot lid is also worth mentioning, being made from aluminum it cools quickly so you don't have to worry about it being too hot for too long, also speaking of hot lids the lid has a built-in strainer with a lid latch so you don't have to hold that hot lid while straining your pastas. I also found that if you don't have a convenient place to set your lid while cooking you can attach it to the handle to keep it off the ground and out of the way. The addition of the skillet was very nice it gave us multiple ways to cook and make more than one type of food at a time.
review.name: Awsome stove system for adventures

review.reviewBody: Camping/fishing on the SF Bay area coast where the wind is a factor.
review.name: Sweet system with pot expansion options!

name: Windburner Stove Group System

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very cute and functional; chose wide for high arches and they fit well; I have a tiny bit of pinching on my arch if I wear them all day with thick socks; obviously the low height may not prevent all water incoming but so far I've been wearing them everywhere and for everything and I've been super satisfied.
review.name: Stylish lil rainboots

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Boots feel very sturdy, are comfortable, and yes totally waterproof! They are thicker than my last pair of bogs, which I appreciate. Green color is also very fun and matches everything in my wardrobe. I think they fit a bit smaller than my last pair, which I also appreciate as a barely fits a 6 foot size! Maybe size up if you are in between sizes though.
review.name: Comfy, perfect!

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wonderful comfort and sustains in all kinds of weather-
review.name: just right!

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots because I needed some cuter rain boots in Ireland/England and these fit all of my requirements. I wore these boots almost every day of the two weeks I was in Europe and they held up so well! They kept my feet dry and were so comfortable, I didn't mind wearing them all the time. I had a severe ankle injury last year (involved surgery) and these made me feel so stable, even on all of those lovely cobblestone streets, and my ankle didn't bother me. I will recommend wearing them before taking them on a big trip; they do some rubbing around the ankles where I wasn't used to having shoes that height. I would highly recommend these boots!!
review.name: Walked All Over Europe

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable! Love them so much!! I got 7 wide. I am typically size 7.5 or 8 in regular shoes but Bogs 7 wide is roomy and comfortable for long walks with my dogs! Super cute too!
review.name: Highly recommended!

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really love my Chelsea boots! They are easy to slip on and off, and it is comfortable to walk in. I typically had to buy separate shoe inserts for all of my other rain boots, but I did not did one for these! I walk our dogs a lot on our 4-acre property, and these are so comfortable for long walks.
review.name: High recommended!

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the style! Have not worn yet because it is summertime but I know they will be perfect for fall/winter and travel!
review.name: Love the style

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots only made it 4 months for me before the sole started separating from the boot. I love the color so I am so disappointed that I have to find another more reliable and durable boot.
review.name: Love the color and sleek look, but they didn't last long

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots in general, unfortunately the color was way off what I was expecting, and they run narrow. Bogs definitely needs more wide width options.
review.name: Nice boots

review.itemreviewed: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are a nice little quick, slip on boot for wet weather. I have a number of pairs of rain boots-most are higher and heavier. These have decent support so they are comfortable to walk in. They will work well when something waterproof is needed but a full boot is too much, like trips to the store or greenhouse.
review.name: comfortable, cute and practical

name: Kicker Rain Chelsea II Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Asolo Arctic GV Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Arctic GV Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Asolo Arctic GV Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love Asolo boots and this is a good one.  The prior reviews correctly stated that this boot is a slightly larger size but that is fine by me.
review.name: Solid boot

review.reviewBody: This boot runs 1/2 to one full size larger than sized. I normally wear a womens 7.5 or 8, and ended up settling on the 7. The seven is still very roomy but is ideally suited to a wide foot ( mine average). This is a very warm boot and my feet have not been cold in it after hiking in snow in WY and CO all winter. Highly recommend, but buy small and dont bother with it is you have a narrow foot.
review.name: Great boot for winter - sized very large

review.reviewBody:
Tried them in the house. They're a half size too big in length. Nice width though. 
Can't give a 3-star because I didn't get to wear them.
Returning.
review.name: Half size too big

review.reviewBody:
I typically wear about a size 39. I wasn't sure about the sizing on these. I have normal to wide feet. Ended up with 39 1/3 (US 7.5) and they fit perfectly! I am a fan of the spacious toe box. It keeps my feet comfortable all day long. 

I've worn them on numerous 13ers and 14ers here in CO this spring (April-June) and they are perfect for trekking through snow and mud. They are comfortable with snowshoes, microspikes and crampons. I typically wear them with gators and my feet stay dry! Great material, very comfortable. 

My boyfriend ended up getting a pair and is equally happy with them. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody:
I?m a consistent US Women?s 7.5 C-width (slightly wide at the ball of the foot) with a regular-volume overall shape, and a high arch. I hike in waterproof Vasques in Spring/Summer/Fall in the Pacific Northwest Cascades and British Columbia / Whistler, but I found the Vasque snow hiking boots were too narrow for my feet. 

These Asolos are near-perfect for winter hiking and snowshoeing: standard fit overall, but slightly wider at the ball of the foot, and the boots have a bit of extra room at the toes - not too much to throw the fit off, just enough to trap the warm air and give your toes and socks the needed wiggle room for warmth in cold weather. Have worn them hiking and will try them snowshoeing soon. If I could add one feature to these, I?d add a bit more height to the ankle shaft (equivalent of one more hook) to keep the snow out. My workaround for this will be my Norrona Falketind hiking pants, which have a built-in boot hook (a hook built into in a pair of GoreTex pants eliminates the need for snow gaiters). 

My one other suggested improvement for these boots would be slightly longer laces: I can tie them at full closure, but I can?t double-knot the laces, which I prefer to do to eliminate laces coming undone mid-hike/snowshoe. Perhaps with wear the laces will stretch out a bit longer... but ideally Asolo would just put in laces 2? longer than these.
review.name: Gorgeous Snowshoe/Hiking Wider Boot

name: Arctic GV Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] kept me warm (down to 1 degrees celcius)! packs down small. LOVE the option of the half zip on one side and full zip on the other
review.name: LOVE IT

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Trek down sleeping bag is so comfortable. It folds down into a very small space. I love the color and how compact it is. It will keep you nice and warm. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: Very soft

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I went camping by the beach and this kept me incredibly warm. It fit me well and was enough for my legs to move around a bit. It was very comfortable and lightweight.
review.name: Great sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag for Women, Regular 15F | -9C, is a high-quality, versatile option for outdoor enthusiasts. Designed specifically for women, it features 650+ Loft ULTRA-DRY Down for excellent warmth-to-weight ratio and moisture resistance. The sleeping bag is spacious, allowing for comfortable movement, and includes a contoured hood and draft collar to retain heat. It's suitable for temperatures down to -9C (15F), making it ideal for three-season use. Overralcthisnis greet for camping or backpacking in cold climates for adventures! It comes with a storage bag as well which is great!
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag can keep me warm even in really cool temperatures. I go both tent camping and camper camping (sometimes without heat while doing the latter.) I love the blue color. Its very appealing to me. However, from the get go the snaps at the top of the sleeping bag broke off. This should never happen on the first use.  There also appeared to be no way for me to even sew them back on. Since this is a mummy bag the top is supposed to go up and keep my head warm.  Im an average height and female. I felt that the top didnt leave enough room to go over my head.  When I tried to turn on my side it was quite uncomfortable. The only way to lay is truly on my back the entire night.   The sleeping bag allows me to unzip at the bottom for my feet, however, that made me feet cold so I zipped it back up. The bag is made of down which is warm but that meant several feathers came out immediately. I tried to use the inner zipper at the top once I was in the bag and the zipper was not smooth.  While the bag is warm, it is uncomfortable and very poorly made. I wont be using this again and will go back to my regular sleeping bag for camping.
review.name: Great color but very poor quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the hooded part of the sleeping bag. Itll be extra warm and comfortable for the head and face. The bottom of the bag has a zipper to let air circulate around the feet. The color of the bag is so vibrant and beautiful. I love the turquoise color. Its super soft with the down insulation and the outside material is soft to touch. Its gonna be so fun to use out on camping trips in the future.
review.name: Gorgeous color and I love the design and materials

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is really nice! It really does keep you warm! It is very comfortable and fits me perfectly! Its easy to back up and light to carry too
review.name: Very nice sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! What a well thought out sleeping bag! Not only is it super comfortable and very well insulated, it has so many excellent ventilation zippers that make it great for so many different temperatures!
review.name: Well Thought out and Cozy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I havent gotten to actually use this product yet but I know its going to be amazing. Its extremely well made, very warm and cozy. It folds up nicely for easy transport and could be taken backpacking as well. Im super excited for our next camping trip!
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag for women in regular size (15F) is a top-notch choice for cold weather adventures. Its lightweight design and high-quality materials make it ideal for backpacking. The warmth and comfort it provides ensure a cozy night's sleep even in chilly conditions. Highly recommended for female outdoor enthusiasts seeking reliable gear for their expeditions.
review.name: Best choice

name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.reviewBody: Fit was solid and similar to other shorts in same size I own. Material was less smooth in some places on outside, which while not an issue, seemed strange.
review.name: Good not great

review.reviewBody:
Shorts are super comfortable and don't move around at all. Would be nice if they offered it with a slightly shorter inseam like the more expensive options. Maybe runs a tiny bit small, but not to the point where I would change sizes. 

My only complaint is the seam that runs up the middle of the front of the chamois. It's not something that impacts the fit or comfort of the shorts, but does result in a noticeable pucker when not on the bike.
review.name: Comfy with Bad Seam

review.reviewBody: Quality shorts are worth the investment. These stay in place and don't require adjustments during your ride. Very comfortable, no chafing and padding is perfect. These are my go to!
review.name: Great Shorts

review.reviewBody: My absolutely favorite hiking boot that I've ever worn! As a doctor of physical therapy, finding the right shoe is so important and this is the perfect balance of supporting natural foot shape and function, comfort, and durability. Highly recommend!
review.name: Favorite hiking shoe ever!

review.reviewBody: I've had these for around a month and have been super happy thus far. I'm in the Seattle area and take daily walks through an often muddy forest trail and these have been great for that. My feet have been nice a dry and I've never felt like they were slippery. A few weeks ago we had record low temperatures and the sidewalks were icy, but I felt super stable in my pisgahs! They are way easier to slip on than any other hiking boots I've tried and the wide sole is super comfy.
review.name: Perfect for everyday wet weather

review.reviewBody: I've about worn out my second pair and plan to get a third. Although these are marketed as a hiking boot; I am a whitewater guide and use them for that. I've done long backpacks in them, climbing tree work in them, and they look good with streetwear if you're just in the city. If Astral stops making this shoe I will freak out
review.name: the shoe of my life

review.reviewBody: I took off two stars because the waterproofing didn't last ten months. I'm going to try a waterproofing spray, because otherwise I love them! Light, comfortable, I like the wide toe box, and they were great for hiking... Until suddenly my toes were soggy.
review.name: Waterproofing didn't last ten months

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable and can't believe how well they fit my foot. I have a weird shaped foot and find it hard to find a good performance shoe so was thrilled to find these fit so well!
review.name: Light as a feather, and so comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these boots. Ive struggled with hiking boots. I was always getting blisters and had bunion pain. Not an issue with the Pisgahs! They are waterproof, extremely comfortable and great ankle support. They fit my orthotics perfectly too. You might have to re-do the laces during your hike to ensure theyre tight enough for the ankle support, but Ive put over 100 miles of hikes on these boots now and I havent had any issues. I cant recommend them enough.
review.name: Great stable and waterproof hiking boot!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots for hiking! They are super grippy (far better than the three other brands that I bought last year!) They wash well in the washing machine.  They dry quickly and, best of all,  they are really light and comfortable. I highly recommend them.  The only thing that could be improved is the footbed. It doesn't have much cushion.
review.name: Great hiking boot.

review.reviewBody: Fits like a glove! I love my Pisgahs for everything from running errands around town to hikes to low tide wanders down in the tidal flats. I wear them loose with the laces untied so that I can just slip them on and run out the door.
review.name: The boot for any adventure!

review.reviewBody: This boot work for sos many situations -- from walking my dog to sliding them on in the parking loot after skiing. I can rely on them to keep my feet dry and give me confidence on a variety oof terrain. They are especially comfortable if you loosen laces and wear casually!
review.name: Great do it all boot

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable boots with easy lacing and support for ankles. I love wearing hiking, snowy walks or even just yard work. Retains great traction in all weather conditions.
review.name: Love for winter hiking/bum around

name: Pisgah Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great, well constructed, nests well even with an older set of pots (2L and 3L sizes. Durable and many potential uses.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody:
I have the medium deep dish plate:

Pluses:----
+ It fits in place of the Trangia 27 frypan/lid, with some protective fabric (of course)...I dont use the frypan so a good swap.

+light polypropylene

Cons:

- there is a mould mark (small 8mm diameter circular indent on the eating surface, surely this should be on the outer so that the eating surface is completely smooth?

-it would be nice if slightly taller (5 or 6cm?) with perhaps a thickened lip.

Regards
review.name: A

review.reviewBody: Love the weight and deep sides but if you need to bring more than a plate that nests with my pots, they take up WAY TO MUCH space. Can these be redesigned to nest into each other so they can actually be brought back country camping?
review.name: nats
The utility is lost due to the fact these plates cannot be nested and stacked

review.reviewBody: I really enjoy how these plates store perfectly with the entire cook set. Makes packing and storage so convenient. I will continue to use this product as long as I can.
review.name: I really enjoy how these

review.reviewBody: I love these deep-dish plates as they can hold more but the weight is perfect for the additional volume. I often use one as tray for food items and the tall edge is welcomed! Great product MSR. Love mine!
review.name: I love these deep-dish plates

review.reviewBody:
Bought two larges and two mediums for two adults and two young children. Primarily for car camping but have some small overnight backpacking trips on the horizon. Currently only used for several car camping trips.

In hindsight I would have purchased 2 mediums and 2 smalls since they are very large and our camp cooking style doesn?t require an enormous plate.

Only negative is that they don?t nest or mate with same size bowls. They?re also way too big to fit into any of my windburner pots from the combo system.
review.name: Great plate/bowl hybrid without nesting

review.reviewBody: Great wall height proportional to diameter! Perfect bottom & wall thickness to support the weight of food without being so thick that they add too much weight. Really wish the same diameter plates (and bowls) nested within each other. Plates nesting inside one another is far more important to me than nesting with a pot. When the family goes camping I now have one plate that nests with a pot and other plates that take up a ton of room that nest with nothing. For those who will never buy more than one plate (or bowl) these are great in nesting with MSR's pots but for those who have more than one person and therefore more than one plate (or bowl) you can do better taking up less space with nesting plates. This product's description really should state in all capital letters that the plates will not nest with each other.
review.name: Deep Dish Plates That Don't Nest

review.reviewBody: Take this product, for example, the specs are completely mixed, and this is not the only place. Hire someone to have a look at your site, so it is actually possible to get actual info from it.
review.name: Please fix all the errors on this website!

review.reviewBody: Great for backpacking when you need to go lightweight. Good sizes.
review.name: Light backpacker friendly plates

review.reviewBody: Awesome piece of gear.  Its lighter than a mouse fart, but warm as a Marshall pufffy combined.  This jacket was purchased with climbing Kilimanjaro in mind and will be bringing it with in January.  The only other puffy that compares is the whisperer/2 which trades a little down loft for a slightly tougher shell fabric.
review.name: Great mid layer puffy

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so light and warm, and I love it, but I wish it could cinch shut at the waist. I had to order a size up because I have big shoulders, but now the jacket lets out a lot of my heat because it isn't cinched tight around my waist properly!
review.name: Good Jacket with One Problem

review.reviewBody: Had this jacket a few weeks now and am blown away. Pack it anywhere, sleep in it, wear it out to dinner, itll do it all.
review.name: Light, warm, and fits well

review.reviewBody: I purchased this jacket as a replacement to my 800 fill Ghost Whisper. I've had several of these jackets over the years and I absolutely love them! I love the grey color of this jacket in the UL now with 1000 Fill. Fit is great and it is ridiculously light! I'd give it 5 stars but my only complaint I have is they removed the waist cinch cord from this jacket, which in my opinion was a big mistake since it helps keep the jacket tight at the waist and prevents the cold wind from finding its way into your coat. Jacket is too roomy at the waist. Also I know weight is an issue here, but a chest zippered pocket would have been bomb as well.
review.name: Best Lightest Jacket around

review.reviewBody: Love it! I just used it on the John muir Trail.This coat is a crucial no brainer and one of my favorite pieces of gear to save weight without sacrificing quality and performance.
review.name: One of the best pieces os gear I own

review.reviewBody: This is my dream super light down jacket and I wear it more than any other during the colder months. I thought the Ghost Whisperer was good until I got one of these and now I only wear the UL. It's so light it almost feels like you're not wearing anything, and at the same time its seems much warmer than similar jackets that are heavier. It's almost like an illusion because when you put it on you warm up quickly yet you don't feel like you're wearing a jacket! It's amazing and there's no excuse not to carry it with you on every mission. It's so small and light. It's more like carrying a wind shell but so much warmer ~!
review.name: Absolutely love it !

review.reviewBody: Mountain Hardwear is the company that you can rely on its quality.  I got Ghost Whisperer UL for my hiking trip to Alpina trail in Swiss.  Yes, it is light, warm, comfortable and sleek in a way.  Good 1000 fill-power jacket is not easy to find especially when it comes to the point that you need very light & compact jacket in your back pack or on you during the long hike in cold weather.  The upper arm has enough room to be comfortable with the inner layer(s) and yet the wrist fits tight enough to slip quickly into wind/rain proof layer.   Since this one does not look too puffy, I think I can wear in the city too in cold season.  I should take this with me to my Korea/Japan trip in the winter.  I am very glad that I added this jacket to my Mountain Hardwear vest that I have used years with 100% satisfaction.  All be with me for many years!
review.name: Best quality as it  stands

review.reviewBody: This jacket is super warm and weighs nothing! It is sleek and the accents give it an extra smooth touch. I liked that it is basic and does not have any extra or unneccessary features. The only thing missing is a zipper pull on the inside of one of the pockets to make it easier to pack into its own pocket. Though the lack of this zipper pull demonstrates the commitment to making this jacket as light as possible without sacrificing functionality or quality.
review.name: The lightest!

review.reviewBody: When weight counts the Ghost Whisperer UL is second to none. It is very warm, very comfortable, and surprisingly durable. I have mine stashed away in my pack on nearly every outing and find myself grabbing it often. The weight is not far from an ultralight wind jacket but comes with 1000FP down! Wow! I mean this thing is REALLY legit. Underrated. A must-have jacket for alpine climbers IMO.
review.name: A jacket that cant be beat.

review.reviewBody:
The jacket is super light and pretty warm for the weight.  It is a good 20-40 F jacket but due to the lightweight, it doesn't keep the heat in.  So, if you happen to be caught out in a blizzard, you are going to be cold.  I haven't had the pleasure of wearing a jacket while it has been windy, so I can't say much on that.  

I didn't rate it a 5 star because of the lightweight of the jacket.  I haven't had any snags so far, but the jacket will lose feathers pretty quickly.  Seems like every time I wear the jacket, I will find a loose feather or 2 poking through the jacket
review.name: Overall a Good Jacket

name: Ghost Whisperer UL Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love these sunglasses!  I wore them on a several day hiking trip in the Sierras.  They were comfortable, stayed on my nose without slipping, and the polarization made the clouds look amazing.  I liked that the lowest part of the lens tint was lighter, making it easier to see the trail. I bought a 2nd pair to wear around town.

review.reviewBody: These sun glasses are perfect for driving because of the lens gradient. Of course, they also have all of the traditional Sunski attributes as well: great looking, comfortable fit, and lightweight along with a lifetime warrant, replaceable lenses, and a low price. What's not to love?

review.reviewBody: Great fit, secure. Probably the fifth or sixth pair Ive owned.

review.reviewBody: I love the color, and they're very light and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I really like the shape of these glasses, and I like the soft yellow color of the frames. Im waiting for them to bring back the bright blue lens that I previously had with the ocean frame color that was discontinued!

review.reviewBody: Love these sunglasses so much. So lightweight, I can wear them outdoors at work all day and not even know theyre there, no pressure points. They dont slip. Great river sunnies too!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody:
Glasses are super cute but the arm snapped after 4 months of use due to cheap material. (I took good care of glasses and wore infrequently.) Way too expensive to break that easily.

I reached out to Sunski to see about getting a repair or refund and never heard back.
review.name: Broke within first few months
comment: Hi Allie, sorry that you're shades are breaking on you. No worries it's covered under our Lifetime Warranty. We sent you an email to help you get a replacement pair!
