review.reviewBody:
I've been riding 25 plus years, and I've purchased bib tights from all of them. What differentiates these bib tights are two things:
-The chamois is excellent. I've never seen one like this before.  A lot of work went into the design and it's clearly unique. You could ride all day in these and not even feel the slightest bit uncomfortable.
-I'm not sure about the inner fleece, but what it does do is keep your legs warm. I've been out in windy mid-30's weather.  You might feel it at first, but it warms up nicely and quickly into the ride, so you don't feel the bite of the cold even on the descents. 
Because of the form fit, it does run a little small. So, I recommend that whatever size you normally use, get the next one up. 
Overall, the workmanship is just excellent. I'll take these over the pricier ones that are out in the market right now.  
 Juan A
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody: Went up a size like most recommend. I'm 5'9", 170, 32-33" waist and went with a large and the fit is pretty perfect. They definitely start a little tight and stretch a little as you ride. The zippers at the bottom are nice. The chamois is second to none, I only buy Castelli with the Progetto chamois, amazing comfort without any bunching or diaper feel. My only knock on these is that they weren't as warm as I hoped, but once you get going and build up body heat you kind of forget about it. That's also probably because I usually layer tights on top of bib shorts, rather than wear a one piece approach like these. 4 stars because I wish they were a little warmer, otherwise perfect.
review.name: Great tights

review.reviewBody:
I?m 5?10, 165 lbs and I got the XL. Great fit. 
I wear L size castelli shorts and L size castelli jerseys. 
Very comfortable. Warm to about 6c. I?m from SE Michigan USA and just went out in them for an hour on some gravel roads. Happy customer.  Just wish they were a bit warmer as I felt a bit colder than I?d like. 

Update:

Took them out for 20 miles today. 0c, wet roads (snow melt). Just not up to the job. Got cold around the privates and legs. Reached out to Backcountry and have exchanged them. 

I think these tights would be good in cool or spring like conditions but not in winter. Great fit and very nice piece of kit. Would re-buy in March!
review.name: Great bib tights

review.reviewBody: Only little small
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: I have a good number of Castelli pieces of bike clothing. As per other reviews, these bib tights are really small and tight. I take Large size in all Castelli and due to warnings from others, I purchased these in a larger XL size. Even doing that, I could hardly fit in them and the bib straps are cut very short. I am only 5?9? and I can hardly stand up straight with them on. Not the predicable sizing I am accustomed to from Castelli.
review.name: Cut very small
comment:
''I am only 5?9? and I can hardly stand up straight with them on.'' 
Unless you got a defective pair I find that hard to believe, I'm 5'11'' 170-175 lbs, 39'' hips, 33.5'' inseam and L fits as expected, very tight (as expected) but comfortable and the straps are actually not as tight as other bibs I own. Also, one should know that bibs straps are usually tighter when standing, compared to when on the bike in riding position, they're not made to walk around in them, they're primarily made for riding comfortably.

Trying to decide if I would need a size L or XL? I am 5' 10" and 162 lbs. 32 waist. 
Any thoughts from users out there? Thanks!

name: Sorpasso RoS Bib Tight - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I usually wear Vans sneakers in a US 6 with thin socks and a US 6.5 for thick socks. I decided to try a size 7 for this winter boots, and they fit well.
 Im looking forward to wearing them in colder weather and seeing if they keep my feet warm.
review.name: Size Up. Excited to Test Warmth!

review.reviewBody: Not sure about these other reviews, I ordered my typical shoe size and it fit great.
review.name: Great Boot, True to size

review.reviewBody: I bought these right before a ski trip that turned into only snowshoeing and I'm glad I did. I didn't have footwear to withstand the cold living in Colorado and shoveling snow, but these fit the bill. I read other reviews and a lot of them said to size up and they were right. I wear a size 10 in sneakers and ordered an 11, which fit great. There was a little room, but with a slightly thicker sock they were perfect. The lining inside kept my feet warm, but not sweaty warm. I was able to snowshoe and shovel snow comfortably.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: Great product with great price. Fast shipping
review.name: Vans MTE boots

review.reviewBody:
These are really nice and cool lookin snow boots. I wear a 12 in most shoes / boots, I ordered a 12 and was snug on my toes. So ordered a 13.  Backcountry was out of stock in March, I contacted customer service, they gave me a refund no problem. Then they told me to call in August when new shipment arrived, so I did, they gave me the 50% off that I originally purchased the first pair for. I cant say enough good things about Backcountry and theyre customer service, 
   Back to the Vans snow boots, get them, you will love them! I promise, also people will comment to you about how rad they are
review.name: So Cool

review.reviewBody: Had to send back and order these in a bigger size for my boyfriend. All is great except for that. He loves them
review.name: Great quality, just run small

review.reviewBody: I had my eye on these boots and finally decided to purchase them. Unfortunately, they were WAY too small. I ordered a full-size larger than I normally wear in Vans. I had to shove my foot into the boot and once I finally got them in my toes were scrunched up against the toe and I knew it was a no-go. I had to return them due to the fit but as a side note, the boots that I was sent were used. This is my first purchase from Backcountry and I don't think this is a used gear site but I could be wrong? I bought the boots on sale but there was no indication that they were used on the webpage listing. The boots I received had some medium brown scuff marks on the white sole and had signs of wear on the fuzzy felt inside layer. I regularly purchase and wear used shoes and clothing so it wasn't a total deal-breaker for me but I was surprised to receive an item in this condition as a first time buyer from this site.
review.name: So small!

review.reviewBody: Very stout toe box. Not sure if this boot is comfortable bc it was so small though don?t think I will be redordering, just returning. This boot felt off. The heel is slanted inward a lot
review.name: Order size up!

review.reviewBody: Multifunctional, it's not just an ascender. It's also a descender and a rope clamp. The release on mine is also extremely easy to operate one handed, with glove. And due to the multitude of holes everywhere it's also useful used remotely to haul material. It's a really a very well thought out tool, the uses are myriad. My only gripe, and this is not really even just the Grivel A+D is, the teeth in the clamp will rip up a rope over time, I wish someone would make the clamping action more like a Rescuescender or Grigri where the surfaces are smooth but still arrest the rope. Overall, My opinion on this Ascender is it's worth every penny, and due to the functionallity almost makes it a no contest when compared to the other major offerings. The only exception being the Climbing technology one with the pulley on it, but I'd still take this over that in any situation involving rocks and climbing. It's also an additional layer of redundancy, if you already carry something to abseil with, now you automatically carry 2 things to abseil with, I think redundancy can be worth it's weight in gold sometimes.
review.name: This thing is Awesome!

name: Up & Down Ascender

My recommendation: if there's more than 1/4 inch of rain forecasted, just use a plastic garbage as a "liner" and you'll be fine.
review.name: Water resistant, yes; waterPROOF, no.

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Echo Quarter Zip Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Echo Quarter Zip Top - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Echo Quarter Zip Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight and comfy. Even in very hot weather, this keeps you cool and dry. Love it!
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: I have numerous Echo tops, which are my go-to for hot weather sun protection. The extremely lightweight, breathable fabric is cool and breathable. I like the higher neckline of this shirt as it protects my neck from UV rays. However, the fabric is doubled up in the collar so it does get hotter in the neck than the rest of the shirt. At least the zipper allows occasional ventilation. A bit tight in the chest compared to the lower part of the shirt. 5''3", 127 lbs size small. The long sleeves with thumb loops provide good sun protection for my hands.
review.name: Sun Protection

review.reviewBody: Great fit and light weight, and good coverage. Will stock up
review.name: Zip is perfect

review.reviewBody: What a great shirt for the shoulder seasons. Super light material and excellent for hiking, biking, pickleball, etc.... Love this shirt. It fits me perfectly. I weigh 130-140 and got a small. It is great for keeping the sun off my skin. I love all the echo shirts.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This is a great shirt for summer hiking in the vegas heat, but why does the men's version have more colors? Wish the fit was more cropped but really like the quarter zip vs. a hoody. It does run a bit large. I'm normally an XS or S top and the XS is a bit looser fit which is good for hotter days.
review.name: Great for summer hiking, wish there were more colors!

review.reviewBody: I love this fabric, I bought this for running in cooler weather and it provides a bit of extra warmth in the beginning and breathes beautifully when I start to sweat. Unfortunately after my second time wearing it, I noticed the seam next to the left thumb hole had stared to tear and the fabric had about a 3 inch run it it. I didn't keep the tags and also don't want to pay for return shipping and so I am choosing to live w it, if it runs further I will try to sew it. I normally love OR products and hopefully this is just a one-off.
review.name: Love the fabric but not that durable

review.reviewBody: I love the echo line - they are super light weight, nice and soft, and dry so so quickly. Quality is great and the fuschia color is full and bright.
review.name: Super lightweight and very functional!

review.reviewBody: Really is cool even with long sleeves. I like being able to vent with the zipper. Fit by normal size is loose enough for air flow, and sleeves nice and long. REALLY do not understand why a cooling garment is offered in black and not more light colors.
review.name: would buy a second if there was another light color

review.reviewBody: As a person with an outdoor career who is also an avid backpacker, I have tried SO many different UPF long sleeves. This has got to be one of my faves. Ultra breathable, thin, and soft. But please, PLEASE make in a light brown or taupe color!! I wore the light blue (arctic) on my Appalachian Trail thru hike and it showed dirt so easily and the area where my backpack straps got permanently stained. But, I'd never go with a darker or more intense color as it would get too hot in the sun (black and fuchsia are not great). Please create in light earth tone colorways so dirt can blend in easier :).
review.name: The lightest weight sun protection!

review.reviewBody: I've worn this backpacking on about 100 miles of the Colorado Trail so far along with other day trips and I love it. It's extremely lightweight, comfortable, protective, and durable so far. It also doesn't retain much odor which is great for multi-day trips.
review.name: Comfortable and durable

name: Echo Quarter Zip Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: Beyond awful. They lasted 1 20 mile ride before the outside started to peal and fall apart.
review.name: Lasted 1 ride

review.reviewBody: Build-quality seems to be quite nice, the fabric feels substantial, with good fabric flexibility, pretty ideal for winter temps. The problem is sizingsize chart put me in a size L, but this being a Castelli-owned brand, I figured two sizes up would be a better fit; ordered a XXL. For reference, I am 178cm tall and a fit 165 lbs. The tights were four inches too short at the ankles, and about the same at shoulders. (That's 8-inches too short! It's like child sizing.) Giving the benefit of the doubt, I tried them in a riding position, but still found the bib straps digging into my shoulders. Returned. [I ordered these elsewhere to get the navy blue color.]
review.name: Strangely short length

review.reviewBody: These Body Fit Pro bib tights, on first impression, have a great thermal feel and compression is fairly strong.  They run a bit small and VERY short in the shoulder straps.  I'm tall, 6'2" and 180 (fairly thin).  I got a medium and the legs are good, just long enough.  Slightly more compression than would be ideal, but still seem like they will be good.  The shoulder straps will need to be extended at least 3" just to get them on.  They might work (upper bib height-wise) for someone of the same weight, but about 5' 9".  I think you'll have to add fabric to the shoulders if you are taller.  I would try a large, but they are out of stock.
review.name: Great feel and compression

name: Bodyfit Pro Bib Tight - Men's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Camp SI Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp SI Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Camp SI Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had limited experience with this pad that I borrowed from a friend but I liked it and so I bought one for myself. However, I invested in a rectangular wide pad to have more comfort, something I strongly suggest since a good night sleep is essential in recovering your energy.
review.name: I had limited experience with

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am 6'1" and this sleeping pad fits me perfectly. So far I have used it for both recreational camping and backcountry trips for work. It inflates and deflates easily and the value of comfort in regards to the weight has been a clear positive trade off for me. I recommend this sleeping pad to anyone who isn't looking to spend a ton of money, but wants to be comfortable on the trail.
review.name: Great sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm not a regular camper and I don't have a lot of experience with sleeping mats beyond an MEC double Reactor 6.5 that I purchased a few years ago. The valve on this mat is BY FAR a better design. It inflates easily, and even more importantly: deflates (and stays that way) easily as well! I'm mostly a side sleeper, F/5'6"/145 lbs, and have slept comfortably each time I've used it. Price was perfect for the amount of use I will be getting out of it.
review.name: Excellent so far!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used it on a 12 day Alaska trip recently. Inflated good, was comfortable, long enough and the reversible valve worked perfectly. Even got wet one day and it dried fast. Could be a little wider and a little thicker but it worked great.
review.name: Sleep pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very comfy mat. Easy to inflate. Packs up easy. Its not tiny but if youre not scrounging for every inch of space this is a great option. Very pleased with comfort of this pad.
review.name: This is a very comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable mat to sleep on. I tested it in mountain conditions, sleeping on the snow with freezing temperatures outside. Didn't feel any discomfort. Excellent isolaton.
review.name: Very comfortable mat to sleep

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not as compact as my prior SI mat but a great product for the price. Air valve is a terrific bit of engineering making it quite simple to adjust to just the right firmness. Kept me comfy and added good insulation from ground temps.
review.name: Good nights sleep

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable, inflates on it own with minimal effort.
review.name: Camp Self-Inflating sleeping pad.

review.reviewBody: Only used this mat a couple times so far. Pillow lock tech is great when combined with sea to summit pillow. It is more affordably priced than comparable mats. Its heavier than many so if ultralight is what one is seeking this mat is not preferred. I am optimistic that the R value makes this a great mat for someone who is backpacking or camping in many conditions and is okay trading off less warmth in winter while carrying little extra weight in summer instead of having multiple sleep mats
review.name: Good for all seasons?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable. Great for car camping. Inflates easily.
review.name: Camp Self-Inflating Sleeping Mat.

review.reviewBody: I've been a 9.5 for 20 years, every single piece of footwear I own. These were quite large, I'd say go down at least half a size. Reorder a 9 and I am worried that will be too large.
review.name: Break boot but size down for sure

review.reviewBody: I typically wear a size 11 wide.  I read a lot of reviews on this boot saying to size down so I thought an 11 D would work.  WRONG.  Too tight and.  So I sized UP to 11.5 and now they fit perfect!  I've walked about 50 miles in these boots so far and there was almost zero break-in time and they are very comfortable.
review.name: Don't size down, size up if you wear EE

review.reviewBody: Bought a 1/2 size smaller due to reviews and fit perfectly. Great looking boot that required little to no break it and that I enjoy wearing on and off the trail. Recently used on several trails in the Smoky Mountains and performed great in mud, gravel, and very rugged terrain we encountered. One thing I did notice was a little slippery on some of the smooth rocks we crossed in the river beds, but maintained it?s waterproof title.
review.name: Danner Nailed It

review.reviewBody:
Summer camping in Oregon.  Worked great. I followed all of the instructions and got solid sleep on this thing. We got the larger size and it fit perfectly in our 4p tent. My gf also got great sleep on it. I think Im gonna buy the hand pump for next time. 

Im not a backpacker, but this thing would be too big for someone counting grams.
review.name: First time (in a long time) car camper

review.reviewBody: Great product.
review.name: Very warm!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this because my partner and I were going on our first camping trip together, and he didn?t have a sleeping pad. I bought the medium size and had an immediate butt-clench, ?this is too small? moment until it arrived and I set it up in the living room for a trial run.

That ?trial run? lasted a week. I?ve been house-sitting for a couple months, and this pad gave me a better sleep on the floor than the bed. As someone used to sleeping on a queen bed at home, this is actually a really comfy ?solo? mat.

I?m 5?4?, and have a tendency to burrow on a good night, so scooting down the mat and having my feet dangle off the bottom is comforting. I?m also on the round end of the spectrum, but my partner (5?6?) and I were able to sleep comfortably and NOT on top of each other during our trip to the redwoods. It probably got down into the mid-40s overnight, and between the mat and the doubled sleeping bags we were warm enough. I definitely feel like the mat reflects heat back toward the body.

It?s also been great to have a spare spare bed. My brother came to visit with an injured back and was unable to sleep on an actual bed, but the mat provides enough that he was able to use it on the floor during his stay.
review.name: Exactly the size I didn?t know I needed

name: DeepSleep Mat Duo 7.5 Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Bahama Vent Relaxed PFG Water Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shoes. They fit perfectly and the sizing seems to be true for me. They are a little stiff the first couple of times you wear them, but they break-in fast. They clean up nicely too if you spill something on them, they simply wipe clean when you get them wet.  They are perfect for the beach or for the boat.  I love my Men's Bahama Vent Relaxed PFG Shoe!
review.name: GREAT SHOE

review.itemreviewed: Bahama Vent Relaxed PFG Water Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This shoe rubs on the back of my feet, unless I wear tall socks, which defeats the purpose of the shoe and the style.  Not a fan at all.  I have worn them 3 times, and I now find myself consistently avoiding these shoes, and I am not likely to wear them again.  Super disappointed, given the price of the shoe.  I have a similar pair that I love, so this purchase was a real let down.
review.name: Not great
comment: Hey there! We are really sorry the fit didn't hit the mark for you. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance!

review.itemreviewed: Bahama Vent Relaxed PFG Water Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and durable summer shoes for types of occasions. Dry fast if they get wet and easy to clean when they get dirty. My first pair has lasted 3 years and Im still wearing them! Bought a new pair just to have on hand when the old pair is done. Fit seems to be true to size, I wear mine with thin or no socks and dont generally have much slipping.
review.name: Great summer shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Bahama Vent Relaxed PFG Water Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered these in my normal size, but had to go down a size to adjust for no socks. So far they are comfortable when walking around i haven't tested them in water or walking for long periods,  so I  don't know if they'll cause blisters. I like the way they look and function for warm days and at the beach.
review.name: Impressive first impressions. Need more time.

review.itemreviewed: Bahama Vent Relaxed PFG Water Shoe - Men's
